params.name: -r, --remote REMOTE
params.desc: git remote of app to run command against

subcommands.name: pg:backups [subcommand]
subcommands.desc: interact with built-in backups. Without a subcommand, it lists all

subcommands.name: pg:backups:cancel [BACKUP_ID]
subcommands.desc: cancel an in-progress backup or restore (default newest)

subcommands.name: pg:backups:capture [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: capture a new backup

subcommands.name: pg:backups:delete BACKUP_ID
subcommands.desc: delete a backup

subcommands.name: pg:backups:download [BACKUP_ID]
subcommands.desc: downloads database backup

subcommands.name: pg:backups:info [BACKUP_ID]
subcommands.desc: get information about a specific backup

subcommands.name: pg:backups:restore [BACKUP] [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: restore a backup (default latest) to a database

subcommands.name: pg:backups:schedule [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: schedule daily backups for given database

subcommands.name: pg:backups:schedules
subcommands.desc: pg:backups:unschedule [DATABASE]                    #  stop daily backups

subcommands.name: pg:backups:url [BACKUP_ID]
subcommands.desc: get secret but publicly accessible URL of a backup

subcommands.name: pg:copy SOURCE TARGET
subcommands.desc: pg:credentials DATABASE                             #  display the DATABASE credentials.

subcommands.name: pg:diagnose [DATABASE|REPORT_ID]
subcommands.desc: run diagnostics report on DATABASE

subcommands.name: pg:info [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: display database information

subcommands.name: pg:kill pid [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: kill a query

subcommands.name: pg:killall [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: terminates ALL connections

subcommands.name: pg:links <create|destroy>
subcommands.desc: create links between data stores.  Without a subcommand, it lists all

subcommands.name: pg:links:create REMOTE DATABASE
subcommands.desc: create a link between data stores

subcommands.name: pg:links:destroy DATABASE LINK
subcommands.desc: destroys a link between data stores

subcommands.name: pg:maintenance <info|run|window> <DATABASE>
subcommands.desc: manage maintenance for <DATABASE>

subcommands.name: pg:maintenance:run [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: start maintenance

subcommands.name: pg:maintenance:window DATABASE WINDOW
subcommands.desc: set weekly maintenance window

subcommands.name: pg:promote DATABASE
subcommands.desc: sets DATABASE as your DATABASE_URL

subcommands.name: pg:ps [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: view active queries with execution time

subcommands.name: pg:psql [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: open a psql shell to the database

subcommands.name: pg:pull <REMOTE_SOURCE_DATABASE> <TARGET_DATABASE>
subcommands.desc: pull from REMOTE_SOURCE_DATABASE to TARGET_DATABASE

subcommands.name: pg:push <SOURCE_DATABASE> <REMOTE_TARGET_DATABASE>
subcommands.desc: push from SOURCE_DATABASE to REMOTE_TARGET_DATABASE

subcommands.name: pg:reset DATABASE
subcommands.desc: delete all data in DATABASE

subcommands.name: pg:unfollow REPLICA
subcommands.desc: stop a replica from following and make it a read/write database

subcommands.name: pg:upgrade REPLICA
subcommands.desc: unfollow a database and upgrade it to the latest stable PostgreSQL version

subcommands.name: pg:wait [DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: monitor database creation, exit when complete
